1.Rathadshamsum Rakbān has dedicated 2.to Dhū-Samī, god of ʾAmīrum, lord of 3.Watrum, this bronze (statuette of a) female camel, the name of which is ʾA- 4.shfāfum, because his lord granted him 5. success in his year 6.as a (?) […], and because he returned in safety 7.from the land of Ḥimyar. And may Dhū-Samī 8.continue to grant him the esteem and 9.good pleasure of his two lords ʾĪlsharaḥ Ya- 10.ḥḍub and his brother Yaʾzil Bayyin, the two 11.kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, sons of Fari- 12.ʿum Yanhub, king of Sabaʾ. And may he con- 13.tinue to grant him [... ...].
